file_content.text: That... that was... over so fast....
Hello, my most beautiful friend. Feel free to visit whenever you like.
Hello, my friend. Always nice to see you.
Rumors are filling the holofrequencies of a daring robbery at our old estate. You've set a lot of tongues wagging.
House Baliss is missing a datapad from their new library.
I'll let my dear sister have the honors. Never could decipher that blasted thing.
It's a simple code woven through the genealogical entries. You just have to assemble the letters correctly, Lenn.
I can't wait to see what's inside.
This is exciting.
I hope it isn't a huge explosion. That would be anticlimactic.
I'm sure Lenn's just being modest, Cedonia.
Your brother isn't a show-off.
Yes, modesty is one of his most famous qualities.
It's true. Everyone says so.
You're obviously the brains of this family, Cedonia.
You should be in charge.
She's also very talented on the vioflute. Oh, and a gardener. And a poet. And--
Lenn, do shut up.
Quit bickering and do it.
You sound just like our old droid governess. I so miss her gentle scolding.
According to this, we must pry open the droid's ventral servomotor housing and disable its lateral conduits.
The holochip is hidden within a false power storage unit, behind a detonite charge. Entering the disarm code.
I hope the pretty lady doesn't explode.
You sure we oughta be standing this close, Captain?
Perhaps you should be wearing gloves while you poke around in there, dear sister?
I've got it! After all these centuries, we finally have our proof.
The information on this holochip proves House Teraan is owed a considerable number of credits.
When the other families hear of this, we will reclaim our status among the nobility.
All that from a little holochip?
Impressive.
It's shocking what they can fit on those things.
I guess congratulations are in order.
Good for you.
Please, there's no need. We're just happy to be rich.
Don't forget who put you back on top.
And you owe it all to me.
I think you'll find us extremely generous to our friends.
I must leave at once to have this data authenticated by the Royal Council. Lenn, see to our hero's payment.
Nothing would please me more, dear sister.
Oh, brother. Let me know when you're done with Slick.
I need you with me, Corso.
Don't leave me alone with him.
Anything you want, Captain.
This might take a while.
Expect a call tomorrow.
This better be business, Captain. I don't trust this stuffed shirt.
Maybe I'll go see what Risha's up to....
We'll be done as soon as he pays me.
This won't take long.
Can't say I'll be sorry.
I knew it! I knew you weren't falling for this guy. Hah!
I thought I'd treat you to a lavish dinner, but it's clear you have other plans.
I want to see more trees. Yell if you need me.
We'll go tree climbing after we get paid.
Stick around, Bowie.
I may not need you for a while.
Climb all the trees you want.
Good. The cool air feels good on my fur....
I'll be finished with Lord Shinypants any second now.
Wait--I'm almost done.
I hate waiting.
Yes, well... you clearly have a pressing schedule, so I won't impose.
Well, here we are. Perfect. I have a little surprise for you.
Surprises aren't really my thing.
Just tell me what it is.
I think you're going to enjoy this one.
I like surprises, handsome.
[Flirt] I can hardly wait.
Is this where you double-cross me?
A trap?
What? You thought I was--oh no, my dear! A thousand times no.
I've arranged a private dinner in your honor. House Organa's chef is the best on Alderaan.
I even hired musicians to serenade you. We'll eat and talk... and dance... and, well, who knows what else?
Thanks, but I have other business.
Sorry, not interested.
Ah, I see. Was it the musicians? Too much? Nevermind. I understand....
Are you planning to propose?
[Flirt] Marriage?
Pro--propose? You mean marriage?
If you just want to be friends, that's fine.
Or are you being social?
Friends? Yes, of course we can be friends. That would be... nice.
Relax, Lenn--I'm only joking. I'd love to spend some time with you.
[Flirt] I'm teasing you.
You sneaky little jester. You're even more fun than I thought.
Follow me to the parlor. The food and musicians are already waiting....
Well. That was... pleasant. I do hope you enjoyed it. I spared no expense.
You're a wonderful host, Lenn.
It was great.
Perhaps we can do this again someday.
You sound a little disappointed.
Are you dissatisfied?
Not at all. I had a delightful time. It's good to make new... friends.
It's a good thing you're rich.
You can afford it.
Yes. Excellent point.
That was a celebration I'll never forget. You truly are the most extraordinary woman I've ever known. So beautiful... so dangerous....
Cut the flattery and skip to the rewarding.
... so ready to be paid.
Why don't you leave Alderaan? I've got plenty of room on my ship.
[Flirt] Come with me.
I want that more than you know, but my family duties aren't yet fulfilled. Perhaps, someday, we'll meet among the stars.
You're quite a woman yourself, Lenn.
...and unsatisfied.
Ha! You're a thorny flower, and that's putting it mildly.
If we get married, isn't half your stuff mine?
That's how it works, right?
Ahem, well... that's maybe a bit more commitment than I had in mind. I--I should really pay you for all your hard work....
Sorry, I prefer real men.
Forget it.
Well. You're no fun. What a waste.
Here, take this datapad to your associate Risha. It contains one of House Teraan's old family recipes.
The design for a powerful anti-radiation shield, which makes a starship immune to all sorts of nasty cosmic rays.
That could come in handy.
I like it.
I can't imagine what you'd need something like that for, but I'm sure whatever it is will be quite exciting.
We have to build this shield ourselves?
Wait, that's it?
It's fairly straightforward--or so I'm told. I'm sure Risha will explain.
This better be the real deal, or I'll be back.
Don't scam me.
While I'd love to see you again, I can assure you this shield design is flawless.
Once you add your bonus for recovering heirlooms from our old home, you'll find you've done quite well.
You have House Teraan's deepest thanks. Someday, you'll have powerful friends on Alderaan. Farewell.
Lenn, take this data and have it authenticated by the Royal Council. I'll see to our benefactor's payment.
I'm sure you will, dear sister.
I want to climb a tree before we leave. I'll be back....
I'll, uh, leave you two alone to negotiate. Call me when you need me, Captain.
I suppose you'll be leaving soon... you don't seem like a man who stays in one place for long.
That's usually how things work.
Good guess.
It's a shame your only experience of my world has been the war. Alderaan has so much more to offer.
I always have time for a gorgeous lady.
[Flirt] I'm in no rush.
There's a charming crudeness to your romantic gestures I can't help admiring.
One advantage to being an honored guest at House Organa is access to their finest food and drink.
I can arrange a special meal for just the two of us. We'll eat, and... talk about your adventures.
My adventures aren't for the faint-hearted.
They might scare you.
I think you'll discover I'm not a faint-hearted woman.
What happens when I run out of stories?
[Flirt] And then?
Why don't we start a conversation and see where things lead?
Follow me to the parlor. We'll pour ourselves a drink while we wait for the food....
Aren't you glad you decided to stay?
This was great, but it's time for me to go.
Absolutely.
Already have one foot back on your ship. I wonder what sort of woman it will take to settle you down....
Why don't you leave all this behind, Cedonia?
[Flirt] Come with me.
That's more tempting than you know, but my place is here. I owe it to my family's legacy.
I promised myself a long time ago that I would live my life without any regrets. Thank you for letting me keep that promise.
It's time you fulfilled your promise to pay me.
Let's finish our business.
House Teraan always pays its debts.
Any other promises I can help you keep?
[Flirt] Happy to help.
Thank you, but no.
Don't get all teary-eyed on me.
Are you gonna cry?
There's no danger of that now, is there?
Of all the women I've known, you're the most recent.
I guess.
Serves me right for dallying with a common spacer....
Sounds boring.
I see. As you wish.
Just give me my reward.
There's no need to be rude. I would never think of denying you what we promised.
This datapad contains your payment for delivering the droid. It's the schematic for a powerful anti-radiation shield invented by House Teraan.
The shield will protect your starship from lethal cosmic rays. You should give the datapad to your business partner Risha.
What's she going to do with it?
Why?
Build the shield, I believe. I assumed you knew all this.
She's more than just my business partner, you know.
Risha and I are close.
Was it absolutely necessary to tell me that?
Don't tell me my business.
I don't take orders.
Those were Risha's instructions, not mine. I don't actually care what you do with the datapad.
I also have your reward for recovering our family's heirlooms. I'm especially grateful for those.
You risked your life for House Teraan, and we'll never forget that. Farewell.
Once we have that datapad from our estate, both our lives will be easier.
You made a deal with a woman named Risha for this droid. I'm here to collect.
Risha sent me.
Welcome home, you ugly little thing. I mean the droid, of course.
This no time for your juvenile jokes. We should properly introduce ourselves. I am Lady Cedonia Teraan, Herald of the Gold Aurora.
And I'm her brother Lord Lenn Teraan, Warden of the Eternal Flame. Please, call me Lenn.
It's an honor to meet people with such fancy titles.
Color me impressed.
Titles are a credit a bucketful here. If you want one, I have a few I'm not using.
You're the best thing I've seen all day, Lenn.
[Flirt] I will, handsome.
The last time a woman made me blush, I was just a boy.
Got news for you, Slick--you're still just a boy.
What should I call your beautiful sister?
[Flirt] Your sister is cute.
"Ceddy." She loves that.
Please don't listen to my brother. He has the unfortunate quality of being an idiot.
I like her.
What did he say?
My friend thinks your sister is cute.
He likes Cedonia.
We may have finally found your perfect match, Cedonia.
Bowdaar thinks you've got all the brains of a gundark.
That you're an idiot.
Well, far be it for me to argue with anyone so... tall.
The Wookiee thinks you're cute.
You're his sweetheart.
Purely platonic, I hope.
What a bunch of hot air.
We may have overdone it with the formalities, dear sister.
My brother and I are all that remains of House Teraan's noble bloodline.
One of Alderaan's more reprehensible pedigrees, House Baliss, slaughtered our family and seized all our holdings.
You still have this old clanker, for whatever it's worth.
Not all of them.
If that happened to me, I'd be raising an army.
You should fight back.
Hard to raise much of anything when you haven't two credits to rub together.
This droid holds new hope for us--literally. Centuries ago, our ancestors hid something inside it for safekeeping.
Pirates absconded with the unfashionable machine generations ago. Tracking it down has consumed our family since before we were born.
Your family drama doesn't interest me. I want my reward.
I don't care.
Well, the droid itself isn't what we're after. We need what's hidden inside.
What that droid contains will rebuild House Teraan, but we need instructions to safely open the hidden compartment. It's rigged to explode, you see.
The instructions are at our family's estate, now occupied by House Baliss's forces. Without those instructions, we can't pay you.
There must be plenty of mercenaries willing to go steal those codes.
Hire someone to help.
We've hired thirty-seven professional thieves. None has returned. Perhaps they formed a club?
You need a professional, huh?
You're obviously talented at acquiring things.
Not my problem--pay up.
Unless we recover what's inside the droid, it's of no use to us.
The instructions we need are in a datapad of Teraan family history at our estate's library.
If you retrieve that datapad, we'll add a substantial bonus to your payment.
And there are some additional family heirlooms we'll pay you handsomely to recover while you're there.
What am I looking for, exactly?
Describe them.
They'll be the valuable-looking things surrounded by guards.
What kind of security does your estate have?
How hard will this be?
Hard to say. I'm sure Baliss installed new systems after we fled.
Sounds like a waste of time.
You're putting yourself in danger already. What's a few extra thefts?
Cedonia, it's almost time for that meeting with House Organa. Why don't you go chat with them in my place?
How shocking, that you'd rather stay and entertain a female guest. Very well, I'll return as soon as I'm able.
I should be going, too.
I don't need to stay.
Don't hurry back.
[Flirt] No rush.
Goodbye.
You don't have to leave on my account.
Is this necessary?
Organa's councilors like me better, anyway.
I thought she'd never leave. My dear sister has the charisma of a Killik. You, on the other hand, are endlessly charming.
I can go look for food, if you want to be alone.
I'd prefer it if you'd stick around.
Please stay, Bowdaar.
Just give me and his lordship a few minutes.
Good idea, Bowie.
Call when you want to leave.
Fascinating friend you have there. I'm gratified he trusts me with you.
Quiet, Wookiee. You're not going anywhere.
Don't move.
Then I will stay.
I hope you're not falling for any of Slick's nonsense.
Don't get your feathers ruffled, Corso.
Of course not.
I'm just looking out for you.
You could learn a few things from Lenn.
He's a gentleman. You're not.
This room's getting a little stuffy for me. Think I'll get some fresh air....
I didn't mean to offend him, but I certainly won't apologize for admiring you.
Zip your lip and sit tight, farm boy.
Be quiet.
Whatever you say, "boss."
I don't mind if your servant hears our conversation. I'm many things, but shy isn't one of them.
When you return with that datapad, I'll have to find a creative means of thanking you.
That really isn't necessary.
Don't worry about it.
I insist. It would be my greatest pleasure.
I've already thought of several.
[Flirt] I have suggestions.
Really? I look forward to comparing notes.
When this droid business is over, I might leave Alderaan. Finally put the blood and feuding behind me.
Spend the rest of my life as a galactic vagabond. Wouldn't that be grand?
You'd walk away from all this wealth and luxury?
What about your nobility?
What good are titles and opulence if you're busy being dead?
If you're looking to roam the galaxy, we should talk when I get back.
[Flirt] I have passenger room.
I hope we'll do more than talk.
Well, keep off my ship. Whiny little nobles don't interest me.
Dream on.
Whiny? Blast, I was aiming for "brooding romantic."
I've monopolized your time enough, for now. Do take care of yourself.
I don't have time to chat.
I really should go.
Oh. Perhaps later, then. Do be careful out there.
Lenn, it's time for your meeting with House Organa. Don't keep their councilors waiting this time.
You just want this handsome stranger to yourself. Next time, dear sister, you get to beg our hosts for their table scraps.
I should head out, too.
I shouldn't stay,
[Flirt] Leave us alone.
I'll try not to come back too soon, dear sister....
Have fun groveling.
You enjoy that.
I never grovel. I flatter. Goodbye, for now.
You talk. I'll go find food.
Take your time here, Captain. I'll go stretch my legs.
I couldn't face another dreary meeting with House Organa's councilors. Thank you for sparing me.
Glad I can be of service.
It's the least I can do.
For someone so rough around the edges, you seem very kind.
I've been looking forward to a private chat since I got here.
[Flirt] My pleasure.
I'll try not to disappoint you.
When I was a girl, I dreamed of adventuring among the stars. What's it like, living that life?
A lot of close calls, mostly.
Trouble.
Some days, I'd rather face bloodthirsty pirates than gossiping nobles.
Come to my ship and see.
[Flirt] I can show you.
That would generate no end of gossip.
This is already quite a breach of etiquette, you know. An offworld man, calling on a lady in private. People will talk.
I didn't call you, Cedonia. You called me.
I've done nothing wrong.
And yet you're still here.
Face it, you can't resist me.
[Flirt] Let them.
I'm often drawn to things I'm not supposed to have.
Regardless, I've kept you from your business long enough. Please, take care of yourself out there.
I should be on my way.
I'll have to tell you some other time.
Sorry, I need to go.
I need to finish this job.
Another time, then. Goodbye, for now.
Welcome to what's left of House Teraan. What we lack in grandeur we make up for in modesty.
